page.title: 12WORCESTER,PITCHCROFT
page.content: The area of Pitchcroft is 100 acres.It is mainly a racecourse. They have 19 race meetings a year.Other sports there are rugby,soccer and lacrosse. Part of Pitchcroft is a camp site for tents and caravans. Near the camp site is a play area,with a roller skating rink,swings,a horse and a helter-skelter. As Pitchcroft is near the river,there is a water-sports centre for the canoe club and the rowing club.You can have boat trips from nearby North Quay-selfdrive,steamers or launches.Lots of people fish from the banks,and walk along the footpath. Fairs come to Pitchcroft for bank holidays,and the carnival gets ready there.Sponsored walks are held round the racecourse to raise money for charity. Pages 8-12 by St Barnabas Primary Sch.
